SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.physics.solid

Interface Solid

All Known Implementing Classes:
BoundingBox, Sphere
public interface Solid
A solid in 3D space. Solids are used for physics calculations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    BoundingBox
    boundingBox()
    Returns the bounding box of this solid for rough physics calculations.
    Vector3
    center()
    Returns the geometric centroid of this solid.
    boolean
    contains(Face f)
    Checks if given face f is within the bounds of this solid.
    boolean
    contains(Vector3 v)
    Checks if given point v is within the bounds of this solid.
    boolean
    contains(Solid s)
    Checks if this solid completely encapsulates the other solid.
    Vector3[]
    corners()
    Returns an array of corners of this solid.
    boolean
    intersects(Ray ray)
    Checks if the given ray intersects this solid.
    boolean
    overlaps(Face f)
    Checks if this solid overlaps the given face f.
    boolean
    overlaps(Solid s)
    Checks if this solid overlaps another solid.
    double
    volume()
    Returns the volume of this solid.

  • Method Details

    • center

      @Nonnull Vector3 center()
      Returns the geometric centroid of this solid.
      Returns:
      The geometric centroid of this solid

    • volume

      double volume()
      Returns the volume of this solid.
      Returns:
      The volume of this solid

    • corners

      @Nonnull Vector3[] corners()
      Returns an array of corners of this solid. If this solid is not a sphere, checking contains(Vector3) with each element of this array will accurately determine if the two solids overlap.
      Returns:
      The array of corners of this solid

    • contains

      boolean contains(@Nonnull Vector3 v)
      Checks if given point v is within the bounds of this solid.
      Parameters:
      v - The point to check
      Returns:
      true if this solid contains the given point

    • contains

      boolean contains(@Nonnull Face f)
      Checks if given face f is within the bounds of this solid. This only returns true if all vertices of this face are within the bounds of this solid.
      Parameters:
      f - The face to check
      Returns:
      true if this solid contains the given face

    • contains

      boolean contains(@Nonnull Solid s)
      Checks if this solid completely encapsulates the other solid.
      Parameters:
      s - The solid to compare to
      Returns:
      true if there is no point of the other solid which is not part of this solid

    • overlaps

      boolean overlaps(@Nonnull Face f)
      Checks if this solid overlaps the given face f.
      Parameters:
      f - The face to compare to
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one point in common between the face and this solid

    • overlaps

      boolean overlaps(@Nonnull Solid s)
      Checks if this solid overlaps another solid. This returns true if there is at least one point in common between the two solids.
      Parameters:
      s - The solid to compare to
      Returns:
      true if the two solids overlap

    • intersects

      boolean intersects(@Nonnull Ray ray)
      Checks if the given ray intersects this solid. This method favors speed over accuracy, and may not be entirely accurate.
      Parameters:
      ray - The ray to check for intersection
      Returns:
      true if the ray intersects this solid

    • boundingBox

      @Nonnull BoundingBox boundingBox()
      Returns the bounding box of this solid for rough physics calculations. Note that bounding boxes do not accurately represent the profile of this solid.
      Returns:
      The bounding box of this solid
